page.title: 06MOUNT HILL FLITWICK'S CASTLE
page.content: BEFORE THE CONQUEST OF 1066 FLITWICK WAS OWNED BY ALWIN,THEN IT WAS TAKEN OVER BY WILLIAM LOVETT,WHO PROBABLY BUILT THE 'MOUNT'. MOUNT HILL IS A FIGURE OF EIGHT VERSION OF THE FIMILIAR MOTTE AND BAILEY,TIMBER AND EARTH FORTRESS. IT STANDS ON A HILL OVERLOOKING WHAT WOULD THEN HAVE BEEN THE MAIN ROAD THROUGH FLITWICK. NOWADAYS THERE IS NO EVIDENCE TO SUGGEST THERE WERE ANY BUILDINGS ON THE MOUNT. THE DITCHES ON THE EAST SIDE HAVE BEEN FILLED IN AND ONLY PART OF THE MOUND STILL REMAINS. THE SITE IS NOW USED AS A PUBLIC OPEN SPACE AND IS SURROUNDED BY RESIDENTIAL BUILDINGS THE MOUNT IS 34 METRES IN DIAMETER,AND ABOUT 7 METRES HIGH. THE MOAT IS 3 METRES DEEP. TREES NOW GROW ON AND AROUND THE MOTTE.
